definition: to be good at/to be expert in
without authority/to usurp/to arrogate to oneself/to monopolize/expert in/to be good at

sentences.english: And light multitaskers might be better at preserving their attention.
sentences.chinese: 並且輕度的一心多用者可能更擅長保持注意力。

sentences.english: This congressman is clever at making scores off hecklers at public meetings.
sentences.chinese: 這位國會議員擅長在公衆集會上駁倒詰難者。

sentences.english: Bellringing is what I'm good at though.
Our guide, who was a French Canadian, was an excellent cook.
sentences.chinese: 我們的嚮導是一個法裔加拿大人，他很擅長烹調。

sentences.english: My grandma is very good at weaving baskets with bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 我的艿艿十分擅長用竹子編籃筐。

sentences.english: Once upon a time there was a doctor who was an expert at treating snakebites.
sentences.chinese: 從前有位醫生，十分擅長治療蛇毒。

sentences.english: This kind of fast, bloody raid is something the Reapers really excel at.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的快速機動使得“收割者”非常擅長搜索。

sentences.english: Our Chineseare are good at tell the good news, not but the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 我們中國人最擅長的，便是報喜不報憂。

sentences.english: But at times, and especially at first, the brain does this work clumsily.
sentences.chinese: 但有時候，尤其是剛開始時，大腦並不擅長做這些。

sentences.english: From wulumuqi , to be adept in flute and zither playing.
sentences.chinese: 來自烏魯木，擅長長笛和古箏的演奏。
我特別擅長說西班牙語。

sentences.english: Dictionaries are still good for obscure usages and etymologies.
sentences.chinese: 字典依然擅長於不常用的用法和詞源。

sentences.english: For this second level it’s a classic base defence of the kind that Men Of War does really well.
sentences.chinese: 第二關是那種戰爭之人系列很擅長的防守關卡。

sentences.english: Helen is very good at throwing the javelin and Mary is very good at running.
sentences.chinese: 海倫很擅長標槍，瑪麗則長於跑步。

sentences.english: Different people specialize in different parts of the process.
sentences.chinese: 不同的人會在流程的不同部分更加擅長。

sentences.english: Most singers are good at posing in front of cameras.
sentences.chinese: 大部份歌手都很擅長在鏡頭前擺姿勢。

definition: to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
